body:
What does the following error mean? It happened when I run `spack install slepc`.

`Error: Conflicting conditional dependencies onpackage slepc for spec slepc@3.8.0%gcc@5.3.0+arpack arch=linux-rhel6-x86_64 ^blas^bzip2@1.0.6%gcc@5.3.0+shared arch=linux-rhel6-x86_64 ^lapack^ncurses@6.0%gcc@5.3.0~symlinks arch=linux-rhel6-x86_64 ^openssl@1.0.2k%gcc@5.3.0 arch=linux-rhel6-x86_64 ^petsc@3.8:3.8.99^pkg-config@0.29.2%gcc@5.3.0+internal_glib arch=linux-rhel6-x86_64 ^python@2.7.14%gcc@5.3.0+pic+shared~tk~ucs4 arch=linux-rhel6-x86_64 ^readline@7.0%gcc@5.3.0 arch=linux-rhel6-x86_64 ^sqlite@3.20.0%gcc@5.3.0 arch=linux-rhel6-x86_64 ^zlib@1.2.11%gcc@5.3.0+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-rhel6-x86_64`
title: Conflicting conditional dependencies error
